title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0185

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine, and today we have a wild lesson for you at the elementary level.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们有一节非常有趣的初级课程。

segments.en: That's right, we are actually going to visit a farm.
segments.cn: 没错，我们实际上要去参观一个农场。

segments.en: So, yeah, it's going to be fun.
segments.cn: 所以，是的，这会很有趣。

segments.en: We're going to see a lot of animals.
segments.cn: 我们会看到很多动物。

segments.en: And not only that, but we're going to learn a lot of interesting words and phrases in English today.
segments.cn: 不仅如此，我们今天还会学到很多有趣的英语单词和短语。

segments.en: But before we get started, let's take a look at Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 但在开始之前，让我们先看看词汇预览。

segments.en: We're not going to be teaching you this song today.
segments.cn: 今天我们不会教你这首歌。

segments.en: Don't worry.
segments.cn: 不用担心。

segments.en: You don't have to listen to us sing.
segments.cn: 你不必听我们唱歌。

segments.en: We do have a great word to start us off.
segments.cn: 我们有一个很好的单词来开始。

segments.en: It's called... the word is The country.
segments.cn: 这个词是……国家。

segments.en: Okay, so you know country as like the United States, Mexico, China, etc.
segments.cn: 好吧，你知道国家，比如美国、墨西哥、中国等等。

segments.en: But in this case, we are going out to the country, not out of the country.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，我们是去乡下，而不是出国。

segments.en: We're going out to the country.
segments.cn: 我们是去乡下。

segments.en: To the country, okay?
segments.cn: 去乡下，明白吗？

segments.en: The country, or you might hear the countryside, is a place that's not like a city.
segments.cn: 乡下，或者你可能会听到乡村，是一个不像城市的地方。

segments.en: So it's the opposite of city.
segments.cn: 所以它是城市的对立面。

segments.en: It means there's lots of grass.
segments.cn: 意思是有很多草。

segments.en: It's very natural.
segments.cn: 非常自然。

segments.en: There are very, very few houses and people.
segments.cn: 房子和人非常非常少。

segments.en: It's very quiet.
segments.cn: 非常安静。

segments.en: So it's the opposite of a busy city.
segments.cn: 所以它是繁忙城市的对立面。

segments.en: It's the country.
segments.cn: 这是乡下。

segments.en: And you have a lot of animals.
segments.cn: 你会看到很多动物。

segments.en: So usually farms are found on the countryside or at the countryside.
segments.cn: 所以通常农场位于乡村或乡下。

segments.en: In the countryside.
segments.cn: 在乡村。

segments.en: So usually farms are found in the countryside.
segments.cn: 所以通常农场位于乡村。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And I personally am a big fan because it's so quiet and peaceful.
segments.cn: 我个人非常喜欢，因为这里非常安静和平和。

segments.en: So we can talk about that in a minute.
segments.cn: 所以我们稍后可以谈谈这个。

segments.en: Let's listen to today's dialogue first, and then we'll be back to talk about some of the words and phrases.
segments.cn: 让我们先听听今天的对话，然后我们会回来讨论一些单词和短语。

segments.en: Isn't this great?
segments.cn: 这不是很好吗？

segments.en: I always wanted to own a farm, live out in the country, grow my own food.
segments.cn: 我一直想拥有一个农场，住在乡下，种自己的食物。

segments.en: This is very beautiful, though I have to confess, I don't know the first thing about farming.
segments.cn: 这非常美丽，尽管我必须承认，我对农业一无所知。

segments.en: That's fine.
segments.cn: 没关系。

segments.en: Don't worry about it.
segments.cn: 不用担心。

segments.en: What was that?
segments.cn: 那是什么？

segments.en: Relax.
segments.cn: 放松。

segments.en: It was just a goat.
segments.cn: 只是只山羊。

segments.en: And that?
segments.cn: 那个呢？

segments.en: It's just the cows that are grazing over there.
segments.cn: 只是那边在吃草的牛。

segments.en: We can milk them later.
segments.cn: 我们可以稍后挤奶。

segments.en: What was that?
segments.cn: 那是什么？

segments.en: Honey, seriously, it's just a sheep.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，真的，只是一只羊。

segments.en: Relax.
segments.cn: 放松。

segments.en: Relax.
segments.cn: 放松。

segments.en: That was just the horses and donkeys that are in the stable.
segments.cn: 那只是马和驴在马厩里。

segments.en: You know what?
segments.cn: 你知道吗？

segments.en: I don't think I can hack it out here in the countryside.
segments.cn: 我觉得我无法适应乡下的生活。

segments.en: I'm going back to the city.
segments.cn: 我要回城市。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So obviously some people cannot go to the countryside.
segments.cn: 显然，有些人无法去乡下。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Some people get very, very upset.
segments.cn: 有些人会非常非常不高兴。

segments.en: In fact, there was a whole TV show in America that was about city people living in the countryside.
segments.cn: 事实上，美国有一整档电视节目是关于城市人生活在乡下的。

segments.en: Let's see if they can do it, right?
segments.cn: 让我们看看他们能否做到，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Alright, but before we talk about that, why don't we take a look at four key words in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，但在我们谈论这个之前，为什么不看看四个关键单词的语言要点呢？

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: The first word is the name of an animal.
segments.cn: 第一个词是动物的名字。

segments.en: Okay, so you've all heard of cows, but have you heard of goats?
segments.cn: 好吧，你们都听说过牛，但你们听说过山羊吗？

segments.en: A goat.
segments.cn: 一只山羊。

segments.en: A goat.
segments.cn: 一只山羊。

segments.en: Alright, so a goat is a strange-looking animal.
segments.cn: 好吧，山羊是一种奇怪的动物。

segments.en: It's kind of skinny, and what do you get from a goat?
segments.cn: 它有点瘦，你从山羊身上能得到什么？

segments.en: You can actually drink goat's milk.
segments.cn: 你实际上可以喝山羊奶。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And many people like to eat goat's cheese, which is cheese made from goat's milk.
segments.cn: 很多人喜欢吃山羊奶酪，这是一种用山羊奶制成的奶酪。

segments.en: Okay, so a goat, can you... and we heard that the sound that a goat makes, so I think it's pretty clear what a goat is.
segments.cn: 好吧，山羊，你能……我们听到了山羊发出的声音，所以我想山羊是什么很清楚。

segments.en: And they're very common, as we say, in farms such as sheep and horses, cows, etc.
segments.cn: 它们在农场中非常常见，比如羊、马、牛等等。

segments.en: That's right, and normally when they're in the wild, they like to live in rocky places like mountains.
segments.cn: 没错，通常它们在野外时，喜欢生活在像山这样的岩石地方。

segments.en: Right, that's why they say they're very good climbers, because they don't fall off the mountains.
segments.cn: 对，这就是为什么他们说它们是很好的攀爬者，因为它们不会从山上摔下来。

segments.en: Alright, and well, if you have cows, then they're probably going to be grazing.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果你有牛，它们可能会在吃草。

segments.en: Okay, so to graze is a verb.
segments.cn: 好吧，吃草是一个动词。

segments.en: It's something we do.
segments.cn: 这是我们做的事情。

segments.en: Well, we people don't do it.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们人类不这样做。

segments.en: Animals do it.
segments.cn: 动物这样做。

segments.en: It's a way for us to describe how animals, like cows, eat.
segments.cn: 这是我们描述动物（如牛）吃东西的方式。

segments.en: It means to eat grass.
segments.cn: 意思是吃草。

segments.en: Okay, so if your cows or horses are grazing, that means they're eating grass somewhere out.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果你的牛或马在吃草，那意味着它们在外面吃草。

segments.en: That's right, they're walking, they stop, they eat some grass, they walk, they stop again.
segments.cn: 没错，它们走，停下来，吃一些草，然后再走，停下来。

segments.en: It's a very slow process.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常缓慢的过程。

segments.en: Alright, so cows are usually grazing out in the countryside, and well, once they finish grazing and they get all fat, then in the mornings you have to milk them.
segments.cn: 好吧，牛通常在乡下吃草，而一旦它们吃完草，变得肥胖，早上你就得挤奶。

segments.en: Okay, so we drink milk.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们喝牛奶。

segments.en: Milk is a thing, but it's also a verb, so to milk something.
segments.cn: 牛奶是一种东西，但它也是一个动词，所以挤奶。

segments.en: Alright, and if you milk a cow is when you extract the milk, the liquid from them, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，如果你挤一头牛，就是从它们身上提取牛奶，液体，对吧？

segments.en: That's right, so underneath a cow, there's an udder, or underneath a cow there are udders, which you have to squeeze with your hands to make the milk come out.
segments.cn: 没错，所以在牛的下面，有一个乳房，或者在牛的下面有乳房，你必须用手挤压才能让牛奶流出来。

segments.en: Okay, interesting word as well, udder, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，乳房也是一个有趣的词，对吧？

segments.en: It's like that big bag full of milk.
segments.cn: 就像那个装满牛奶的大袋子。

segments.en: Exactly, so to milk a cow.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以挤牛奶。

segments.en: Alright, and you have cows out in the fields grazing, and probably your horses and donkeys are going to be in the stable.
segments.cn: 好吧，你在田野里有牛在吃草，可能你的马和驴会在马厩里。

segments.en: The stable is a place, okay, so this is something that's often found on farms, where the horses or the cows live.
segments.cn: 马厩是一个地方，好吧，这通常是在农场上找到的，马或牛生活的地方。

segments.en: It's a structure, it's a building for those animals.
segments.cn: 这是一个结构，是这些动物的建筑。

segments.en: Okay, so they're probably separated in different little rooms or compartments, and that's called a stable, so as you say, you usually find horses and cows and donkeys in there.
segments.cn: 好吧，它们可能被分开在不同的小房间或隔间里，这叫做马厩，所以正如你所说，通常你会在里面找到马、牛和驴。

segments.en: That's right, so a stable is a way to protect animals from the weather.
segments.cn: 没错，所以马厩是保护动物免受天气影响的一种方式。

segments.en: Alright, very good, so four key words there, as we just saw.
segments.cn: 好吧，非常好，所以我们刚才看到的四个关键单词。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to this dialogue again, and we'll be back soon.
segments.cn: 为什么不再听一次这个对话，我们很快会回来。

segments.en: Isn't this great?
segments.cn: 这不是很好吗？

segments.en: I always wanted to own a farm, live out in the country, grow my own food.
segments.cn: 我一直想拥有一个农场，住在乡下，种自己的食物。

segments.en: This is very beautiful, though I have to confess, I don't know the first thing about farming.
segments.cn: 这非常美丽，尽管我必须承认，我对农业一无所知。

segments.en: That's fine.
segments.cn: 没关系。

segments.en: Don't worry about it.
segments.cn: 不用担心。

segments.en: What was that?
segments.cn: 那是什么？

segments.en: Relax.
segments.cn: 放松。

segments.en: It was just a goat.
segments.cn: 只是只山羊。

segments.en: And that?
segments.cn: 那个呢？

segments.en: It's just the cows that are grazing over there.
segments.cn: 只是那边在吃草的牛。

segments.en: We can milk them later.
segments.cn: 我们可以稍后挤奶。

segments.en: What was that?
segments.cn: 那是什么？

segments.en: Honey, seriously, it's just a sheep.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，真的，只是一只羊。

segments.en: Relax.
segments.cn: 放松。

segments.en: Relax.
segments.cn: 放松。

segments.en: That was just the horses and donkeys that are in the stable.
segments.cn: 那只是马和驴在马厩里。

segments.en: You know what?
segments.cn: 你知道吗？

segments.en: I don't think I can hack it out here in the countryside.
segments.cn: 我觉得我无法适应乡下的生活。

segments.en: I'm going back to the city.
segments.cn: 我要回城里。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利构建器。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利构建器。

segments.en: You know Marco, I have to confess.
segments.cn: 你知道吗，马尔科，我必须承认。

segments.en: I love Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我喜欢流利构建器。

segments.en: Alright, and that's our first phrase for today.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们今天的第一个短语。

segments.en: I have to confess.
segments.cn: 我必须承认。

segments.en: Okay, so to confess is to tell someone something that's a secret.
segments.cn: 好吧，承认就是告诉某人一个秘密的事情。

segments.en: Okay, so we can confess with a priest.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们可以向神父承认。

segments.en: No, so we can confess to a priest.
segments.cn: 不，我们可以向神父承认。

segments.en: We can confess a secret to a friend.
segments.cn: 我们可以向朋友承认一个秘密。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: But I have to confess is a very common phrase.
segments.cn: 但我必须承认是一个非常常见的短语。

segments.en: It's a way for us to start a sentence.
segments.cn: 这是我们开始句子的方式。

segments.en: I have to confess.
segments.cn: 我必须承认。

segments.en: Right, so you're saying I have to be honest with you.
segments.cn: 对，所以你是在说我必须对你诚实。

segments.en: I have to tell you the truth.
segments.cn: 我必须告诉你真相。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So I have to confess.
segments.cn: 所以我必须承认。

segments.en: I'm not a huge fan of that sweater.
segments.cn: 我对那件毛衣并不太喜欢。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So I have to be honest.
segments.cn: 所以我必须诚实。

segments.en: I really don't like your sweater.
segments.cn: 我真的不喜欢你的毛衣。

segments.en: This is a way for us to be more polite when we're saying something that's negative.
segments.cn: 这是一种在说负面事情时更礼貌的方式。

segments.en: And in this case, it was the girl who was confessing, and what she confessed is her second key phrase.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，是那个女孩在承认，她承认的就是她的第二个关键短语。

segments.en: I don't know the first thing about farming.
segments.cn: 我对农业一无所知。

segments.en: Okay, so I don't know anything about farming is another way we could say this, or I don't know a thing about farming, but I don't know the first thing about farming means I don't even understand what a farm is.
segments.cn: 好吧，我对农业一无所知是我们可以这样说的另一种方式，或者我对农业一无所知，但我对农业一无所知意味着我甚至不理解农场是什么。

segments.en: Okay, the first thing is what is a farm?
segments.cn: 好吧，第一件事是农场是什么？

segments.en: I don't even understand what a farm is for.
segments.cn: 我甚至不明白农场的用途。

segments.en: This is a way for us to say I don't know anything at all about this.
segments.cn: 这是一种说我对这完全不了解的方式。

segments.en: And if we change the noun, right, and we can say, for example, I don't know the first thing about cars.
segments.cn: 如果我们换个名词，对吧，我们可以说，例如，我对汽车一无所知。

segments.en: So I have no idea of what models they are or what type of engine they have.
segments.cn: 所以我对它们的型号或发动机类型一无所知。

segments.en: I don't know the first thing about cars.
segments.cn: 我对汽车一无所知。

segments.en: All I know is how to turn them on.
segments.cn: 我只知道怎么启动它们。

segments.en: Right, right.
segments.cn: 对，对。

segments.en: Or I don't know the first thing about wines.
segments.cn: 或者我对葡萄酒一无所知。

segments.en: I'd love to learn about wine, but I don't know the first thing about it.
segments.cn: 我想了解葡萄酒，但我对它一无所知。

segments.en: Okay, so it's a phrase that you can use with many, many different nouns, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一种你可以用在许多不同名词上的短语，对吧？

segments.en: I don't know the first thing about architecture.
segments.cn: 我对建筑一无所知。

segments.en: I don't know the first thing about English.
segments.cn: 我对英语一无所知。

segments.en: Right, well, we do, and that's why we're here to help you.
segments.cn: 对，好吧，我们确实知道，这就是我们在这里帮助你的原因。

segments.en: But this is a really great phrase to describe not understanding anything at all about something.
segments.cn: 但这是一个非常好的短语，用来描述对某事完全不理解。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So this is a really great way to describe not knowing anything at all about something.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常好的方式来描述对某事完全不了解。

segments.en: Okay, and well, obviously, since she didn't know the first thing about farming, she ended up leaving.
segments.cn: 好吧，显然，由于她对农业一无所知，她最终离开了。

segments.en: And she said, you know what?
segments.cn: 她说，你知道吗？

segments.en: I don't think I can hack it out here in the countryside.
segments.cn: 我觉得我无法适应乡下的生活。

segments.en: Okay, so I can hack it.
segments.cn: 好吧，我可以适应。

segments.en: He can't hack it.
segments.cn: 他无法适应。

segments.en: We use this with the verb to be able to, and it means I don't think I can do this.
segments.cn: 我们用这个动词来表示能够，这意味着我觉得我无法做到这一点。

segments.en: I think this is too hard.
segments.cn: 我觉得这太难了。

segments.en: Or maybe if somebody quit, right, after a week at the office, and you can say he couldn't hack it.
segments.cn: 或者如果有人在办公室工作一周后辞职，你可以说他无法适应。

segments.en: He couldn't hack the pressure, and he left.
segments.cn: 他无法承受压力，然后离开了。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So that means to handle or to be able to handle or to withstand.
segments.cn: 这意味着处理或能够处理或承受。

segments.en: So I just don't think I can hack the cold.
segments.cn: 所以我只是觉得我无法忍受寒冷。

segments.en: Right, I can't handle the cold.
segments.cn: 对，我无法忍受寒冷。

segments.en: It's too cold here.
segments.cn: 这里太冷了。

segments.en: I'm moving somewhere warm.
segments.cn: 我要搬到一个温暖的地方。

segments.en: Alright, so I'm sure you guys will be able to hack our dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我相信你们会最后一次适应我们的对话。

segments.en: So let's listen to it, and we'll be back.
segments.cn: 所以让我们听一听，我们马上回来。

segments.en: Isn't this great?
segments.cn: 这不是很好吗？

segments.en: I always wanted to own a farm, live out in the country, grow my own food.
segments.cn: 我一直想拥有一个农场，住在乡下，种自己的食物。

segments.en: This is very beautiful, though I have to confess, I don't know the first thing about farming.
segments.cn: 这非常美丽，尽管我必须承认，我对农业一无所知。

segments.en: That's fine.
segments.cn: 没关系。

segments.en: Don't worry about it.
segments.cn: 不用担心。

segments.en: What was that?
segments.cn: 那是什么？

segments.en: Relax, it was just a goat.
segments.cn: 放松，只是只山羊。

segments.en: And that?
segments.cn: 那个呢？

segments.en: It's just the cows that are grazing over there.
segments.cn: 只是那边在吃草的牛。

segments.en: We can milk them later.
segments.cn: 我们可以稍后挤奶。

segments.en: What was that?
segments.cn: 那是什么？

segments.en: Honey, seriously, it's just a sheep.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，真的，只是一只羊。

segments.en: Relax.
segments.cn: 放松。

segments.en: Relax, that was just the horses and donkeys that are in the stable.
segments.cn: 放松，那只是马和驴在马厩里。

segments.en: You know what?
segments.cn: 你知道吗？

segments.en: I don't think I can hack it out here in the countryside.
segments.cn: 我觉得我无法适应乡下的生活。

segments.en: I'm going back to the city.
segments.cn: 我要回城里。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So as you said, you're a fan of the countryside and about farming, right?
segments.cn: 所以正如你所说，你是乡村和农业的粉丝，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Well, I wish I knew more about farming.
segments.cn: 我希望我能多了解一些农业。

segments.en: I don't know the first thing about milking a cow, but I do come from a part of the world in Illinois near Chicago where we have a lot of farms and I appreciate the quiet and it's nice.
segments.cn: 我对挤牛奶一无所知，但我来自伊利诺伊州靠近芝加哥的一个地方，那儿有很多农场，我很欣赏那里的安静，感觉很好。

segments.en: Having animals around and being able to go on long walks without cars and horns and bicycles.
segments.cn: 周围有动物，能够在没有汽车、喇叭和自行车的情况下长时间散步。

segments.en: It is actually a little bit refreshing to be out in the countryside sometimes and not even have Internet or cell phone coverage or anything.
segments.cn: 有时候在乡下待着，甚至没有互联网或手机信号，实际上是有点清新的。

segments.en: So it's just basically, you can't do anything else but relax, read a book, talk to people.
segments.cn: 所以基本上，你只能放松、读书、和人聊天。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Now an interesting thing about this is a lot of people take for granted the countryside because I've met many people who live in the city, who grew up in the city and have never seen, for example, a live chicken.
segments.cn: 现在有趣的是，很多人对乡村视而不见，因为我遇到过很多生活在城市、在城市长大的人，他们从未见过活鸡。

segments.en: And when they see it they just freak out and take pictures with the chicken or a cow or something.
segments.cn: 当他们看到时，他们会惊慌失措，和鸡或牛拍照。

segments.en: It's amazing.
segments.cn: 这太神奇了。

segments.en: That's really funny.
segments.cn: 这真的很有趣。

segments.en: Well I think it's very valuable.
segments.cn: 我认为这非常有价值。

segments.en: I think there are very valuable skills that you learn being out in the countryside like how to cook for yourself.
segments.cn: 我认为在乡下你能学到很多有价值的技能，比如如何自己做饭。

segments.en: There's no one else who can cook for you or how to get food from animals.
segments.cn: 没有人能为你做饭，或者如何从动物那里获取食物。

segments.en: Or maybe you can't even use a microwave so how do you cook without a microwave or something?
segments.cn: 或者也许你甚至不能用微波炉，那你怎么在没有微波炉的情况下做饭呢？

segments.en: That's right and I think the biggest problem for city people when they come to the countryside is that it's dirtier.
segments.cn: 没错，我认为城市人来到乡下最大的麻烦是这里更脏。

segments.en: You know you get mud and there are bugs and I imagine some of our co-workers here having a very hard time in the countryside.
segments.cn: 你知道的，会有泥土和虫子，我想我们的一些同事在乡下会很难适应。

segments.en: Yes, indeed.
segments.cn: 是的，确实如此。

segments.en: So why don't you guys come to our website EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 所以你们为什么不来我们的网站 EnglishPod.com 呢？

segments.en: Let us know what you think about this.
segments.cn: 让我们知道你对此的看法。

segments.en: Maybe you're very familiar with the countryside or have a relative who's a farmer.
segments.cn: 也许你对乡村非常熟悉，或者有个亲戚是农民。

segments.en: It's great.
segments.cn: 太好了。

segments.en: So visit us EnglishPod.com and if you have any questions or comments you can leave them there as well.
segments.cn: 所以访问我们 EnglishPod.com，如果你有任何问题或评论，也可以在那里留言。

segments.en: Can't wait to hear from you.
segments.cn: 迫不及待想听到你的消息。

segments.en: Happy studies.
segments.cn: 学习愉快。

segments.en: Bye everyone.
segments.cn: 大家再见。
